item.title: Tangent Lines and Non-Existent Ones
item.description: Definition of a Tangent Line Slope of a Tangent Line on a Curve Condition for Existence Limit of an Absolute Value Problem Solution Definition of a Tangent Line Consider a curve \(y = f(x)\), and let \(P\) be a given fixed point on this curve. Let \(Q\) be a second nearby point on the curve, and draw the secant line \(PQ\). The tangent line at \(P\) can now be thought of as the limiting position of the variable secant as \(Q\) slides along the curve toward \(P\).
